This page explains our Terms of Service. When you use KidEverest, you’re agreeing to all the rules on this page.

Terms Of Service

Effective: November, 16, 2018

Welcome to KidEverest (“Site” or “Website”), a crowdfunding platform that empowers individuals of all ages to raise money online. KidEverest (“KidEverest,”) is owned and operated by KidEverest LLC. Please read these Terms and Conditions of Use (“Terms”) carefully before using the Site. By accessing or using our Site, you (“user”) agree to be bound by this agreement. If you do not agree, with these Terms, do not use this Site.

  1. Acceptance of Terms

For Users

It is important that you go through these Terms so that you know what you can or cannot do on this Site. If you are under 13, go through the Terms with a parent or legal guardian so they can help you register. When you create an account and accept this agreement, you become a member. If you are under 13, this means that you accept the conditions below and that you confirm that your parent or a legal guardian has read and accepted the conditions.

For Parents

Contact us at hello@kideverest.com if you do not accept this agreement and you believe your child has already become a member of KidEverest. Members under 13 will not be able to proceed without parental permission, which is necessary to activate their fundraising capabilities.  In some cases, it will be deemed appropriate to grant permission through educational institutions. Until the appropriate level of parental consent is obtained your child will not be able to proceed to use the Site and cannot publish anything to the Internet.

KidEverest reserves the right to update the Terms at anytime without notice. Changes are effective immediately upon posting. We may contact you when changes are made but your continued use of the Site constitutes your acceptance of the revised Terms. By using and accessing our Site, you agree to our Terms and any other policies/legal notices that we post on our Site.

  1. Definitions and Description of Service

KidEverest’s services include our website and any additional features, content, and functionality offered by us in connection with the Site.

  • A “Visitor” is someone who is browsing through the Site.
  • A “Team Member” is someone who registers an account and belongs to a team.
  • A “Parent” is a legal parent or guardian or educational institution official (who has gained appropriate permission from a legal parent or guardian,) whose child has registered with the Site.
  • A “Supporter” or “backer” is someone who gives or donates money to a fundraiser on the site.
  • Team Members and parents are collectively referred to as “Members.” Valid and accurate completion of the registration process leads to “Membership.” Visitors and Members are referred to collectively as “Users” or “you.”
  1. Membership Obligations

You agree to:

  • Provide true, accurate, current, and complete information when using the site, not limited to information about yourself, your organizations, and your fundraising activities. You will maintain the accuracy of all information you provide to us by updating it promptly. You authorize us to make inquiries, either directly or through third parties, to validate the registration information of Parents. We reserve all rights to suspend or terminate your account, refuse any current or future use of the service, take legal action against anyone who misrepresents personal information or is not truthful about their identity, or presents inaccurate and incomplete information. However, you acknowledge that we cannot guarantee by 100% the accuracy of any information submitted by any User of the Site, nor any identity information about any User.
  • Parents may only register their own children, unless they are the child’s legal guardian (collectively “Parent”). A Team Member’s membership may be terminated without warning, if we believe that the Team Member is impersonating a child. A Parent Membership (and concurrently an associated Child’s Membership) may be terminated without warning if we believe that you are under 18 years old or are not the legal Parent of any child you have approved for membership on this Site.
  1. Fees and Payments

KidEverest is free to join. We do, however, charge fees for donations received. We update notification of those fees on our How it Works page. We reserve the right to change the fees from time to time. Changes are effective immediately after we provide you with notice on the Site. We may also temporarily change the fees for our services for promotions. These changes are effective when we post it on the Site.

All funds from donors are processed through Stripe or PayPal, third-party payment processors. All contributions are made one-time only and are limited to an amount specified by the donor. Funds are transferred to an account setup by the Member or individual designated to receive fundraiser proceeds from a backer directly through Stripe or Paypal, in the total amount of money given to the fundraiser minus credit card and transaction fees charged by our payment processors. Due to the occasional failures of some credit cards, KidEverest cannot guarantee the full receipt of the amount. Organizations and individuals whose account is connected by Paypal or Stripe is responsible for taxes applicable based on their net income or gross receipts. In some cases, taxes can be exempt. You are encouraged to consult a qualified tax profession to assess you specific tax situation.

KidEverest campaigns are all or nothing. These campaigns must be fulfilled 100% of asking, or funds will be returned to the donors.

Refunds requested by donors are the responsibility of fundraising Parents and can be processed by Kid Everest admin is requested during an active fundraiser. Donations requested following the completion of the fundraiser after all funds are disbursed will be the responsibility of the fundraiser Parent and any affiliated organization. These refunds are not able to be processed through KidEverest after the fundraiser has completed because the funds have already been distributed to your bank account.

You are responsible for paying any fees associated with donations made through Kid Everest. A percentage-based transaction fee + credit card processing fee will be deducted from each online contribution received on Kid Everest. Contributions are subject to this fee one time-only. By launching your fundraiser, you agree to these terms. You will not be responsible for paying any fees if no money is received or donations are fully refunded. For more information on fees and how they work, please see our How it Works.

In the event a fundraiser is removed from the Service for violating the Terms of Use, all fees paid are non-refundable, unless in its sole discretion Kid Everest determines that a refund is appropriate. User understands and agrees that our payment processors may alter their transaction fees at any point and such alterations are beyond the control of Kid Everest. Kid Everest reserves the right to change fees and will give notice of these changes to users by posting on the Site.

  1. Raising Money on Kid Everest

Kid Everest is a website for fundraising and allows Parents to create and post fundraisers with their team members. Kid Everest is not liable for your interactions with any organizations or individuals found on our Site. This includes, but is not limited, to the representations, warranties, and terms associated with fundraisers listed on Kid Everest. Kid Everest is not responsible for any damages or losses incurred as a result of dealings between you and such organizations or individuals.

Kid Everest is under no obligation to become involved with disputes between Members and Backers, or between users and third parties. In the event of a dispute, you release Kid Everest and its parent company, its officers, employees, agents and successors in rights from claims, damages and demands of every kind, regardless if they are known, suspected, or disclosed, that arise from or are in any way related to such disputes and our service.

Though Kid Everest cannot be held liable for the actions of its users and members, they are nevertheless responsible for fulfilling obligations both implied and stated in any fundraiser they create. Kid Everest reserves the right to cancel a fundraiser and refund all associated backer’s payments at any time for any reason. Kid Everest reserves the right to remove a fundraiser, or suspend the listing from public listings for any reason.

  1. Rules and Conduct

Postings which contain any of the below shall be considered in violation of this Terms of Use Agreement:

  • Personal information which might identify a user or person that has not been approved by a child’s parent
  • Profanity, obscenities, and personal attacks, bullying, or stalking of other individuals
  • Impersonation of any person or entity without their consent, including, but not limited to, a KidEverest employee, or falsely stating or otherwise misrepresenting your affiliation with a person or entity
  • Slanderous, defamatory, obscene, pornographic, libelous, threatening, abusive, harassing, hateful, or otherwise objectionable, and any other information that Kid Everest, in its sole discretion, deems to be inappropriate for the site
  • Actions to upload, post, e-mail or otherwise transmit Content that infringes or violates any third party rights, contains any viruses or other programs that are intended to do damage or intercept data, contains any form of solicitation that we consider in Kid Everest’s sole discretion to be unsolicited and unauthorized, interferes or disrupts the Site or servers &. networks connected to the Site, or disobeys any policies or regulations of networks connected to the Site

Kid Everest will make every effort to ensure that the Site best serves the interests of all users, and, therefore, Kid Everest reserves the right to edit, delete, or refuse to post content that violate the above-referenced rules of participation, as well as revoke the privileges of users who do not comply with such rules. For more information, please see our Rules and Prohibited Items.

If you believe that any content on the Site violates any of the provisions of these Terms, please send us a message at hello@KidEverest.com. We reserve the right to take, or refrain from taking, any or all actions available to us once we receive a message.

We do not guarantee that others on the Site are or will comply with the Rules of Conduct or provisions of these Terms. You, not Kid Everest, assumes all risk of harm or injury resulting from any such lack of compliance.

  1. No Commercial Use

The Site is only for your personal use. You may not use the Site for commercial purposes or in any way that is unlawful, or harms us or any other person or entity.

You agree to grant to us a royalty-free, worldwide, non-exclusive, sub-licensable right and license to exercise the copyright, publicity, and database rights you have in your Membership information, including any information generated by your Membership activity, in any media now known or not currently known, in accordance with our Privacy Policy. You agree that even though you may retain certain copyright or other intellectual property rights with respect to Content you post or upload while using the Site, you do not own the Membership you use to access the Site, nor do you own any data we store on our servers.

Except as when we specifically agree in writing, no Content from the Site may be used, reproduced, transmitted, distributed or otherwise exploited in any way other than as part of the Site, except that where the Site enables the download of particular Content if you do not use the Content in an unlawful manner or in a manner that suggests an association with any of our products, services or brands. We do not transfer the ownership of any copyrights, trademarks, slogans, service marks, trade names, trade dress or other proprietary rights in the Site or Content to you or any third party nor authorize you to create derivative works based on the Content.

You further understand and acknowledge that you may be exposed to Member Content that may be inaccurate or that you find offensive or objectionable, and you agree to waive any legal or equitable rights or remedies you have or may have against us, and agree to indemnify and hold Kid Everest, its shareholders, partners, affiliates, directors, officers, subsidiaries, employees, agents, suppliers, licensees, and distributors harmless to the fullest extent allowed by law regarding all matters related to your use of the Site.

Certain features or areas of the site may offer open communication between Backers such as posting comments. You acknowledge these areas are for public and not private communications, and you have no expectation of privacy with regard to submissions in these areas. We make all such disclosures at your own risk. You are solely responsible for the Content you distribute on or through the Site under your username or otherwise by you.

You have a nonexclusive, limited, revocable license to use the Site while you are in compliance with this Agreement. You agree to follow certain rules of conduct and other rules that prohibit practices that we deem as harmful. These rules apply to all Users and Members, including Visitors, Parents and Children. We reserve the right to take appropriate legal action against anyone who, in our sole discretion, violates any of these terms, including removing the offending content from the Site and terminating the Membership of such violators and any other involved parties.

  1. Links to Other Websites and Content

The appearance of external links and postings made by third parties on the Site does not mean that Kid Everest endorses the opinions or views expressed. When you access third party websites, you do so at your own risk. These other websites are not under Kid Everest’s control. Kid Everest is not responsible or liable for any aspect of such websites. You further acknowledge and agree that Kid Everest is not responsible or liable, directly or indirectly, for any damage or loss caused or alleged to be caused by or in connection with the use of or reliance on any such Content, goods or services available on or through any such website or resource.

  1. Limitation of Liability

You release Kid Everest (and our shareholders, partners, affiliates, directors, officers, subsidiaries, employees, agents, suppliers, licensees, and distributors) from claims, demands and damages (actual and consequential) of every kind and nature, known and unknown, suspected and unsuspected, disclosed and undisclosed, arising out of or in any way connected with any dispute you have or claim to have with one or more Users or Members of the Site. You agree that: (a) we will have the right but not the obligation to resolve disputes between Users or Members relating to the Site, and our resolution of any particular dispute does not create an obligation to resolve any other dispute. (b) to the extent we elect to resolve such disputes, it will do so in good faith based solely on the general rules and standards of the Site and will not make judgments regarding legal issues or claims. (c) our resolution of such disputes will be final with respect to the Site but will have no bearing on any real-world legal disputes in which Users or Members of the Site may become involved. and (d) you hereby release Kid Everest (and our shareholders, partners, affiliates, directors, officers, subsidiaries, employees, agents, suppliers, licensees, and distributors) from claims, demands and damages (actual and consequential) of every kind and nature, known and unknown, suspected and unsuspected, disclosed and undisclosed, arising out of or in any way connected with our resolution of disputes relating to the Site.

  1. Privacy Policy

Use of the Site is governed by our Privacy Policy, which is incorporated herein by reference and is also subject to change from time to time.

  1. Governing Law

This Agreement and the relationship between you and Kid Everest shall be governed in all respects by the laws of the State of New Hampshire without regard to conflict of law principles. You and Kid Everest agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the courts located in New Hampshire except as provided below regarding optional arbitration.

Optional Arbitration For any Claim, excluding Claims for injunctive or other equitable relief, where the total amount of the award sought is less than ten thousand U.S. Dollars ($10,000.00 USD), shall be settled through arbitration that takes place in New Hampshire, in the English language and the arbitral decision may be enforced in any court. The prevailing party in any action or proceeding to enforce this Agreement shall be entitled to costs and attorneys’ fees. The party electing arbitration shall initiate it through an established alternative dispute resolution (“ADR”) provider mutually agreed upon by the parties.

  1. Termination

Kid Everest may terminate your access to all or any part of the Service at any time, with or without cause, with or without notice, effective immediately, which may result in the forfeiture and destruction of all information associated with your membership. If you wish to terminate your account, you may do so from your account profile online or by emailing hello@KidEverest.com. Any fees paid hereunder are non-refundable.

documents.name: Privacy Policy
documents.text:
This page explains our Privacy Policy. When you use Kid Everest, you’re agreeing to all the rules on this page.

Privacy Policy

Effective: November 16, 2018

Kid Everest (“Kid Everest” or our “Site”) is owned and operated by Kid Everest LLC. Kid Everest is a fundraising platform that individuals of ages 18 and under raise money online for their projects and inventions. We are dedicated to creating a safe online environment.

Kid Everest is committed to protecting the privacy of any personal information collected or received during the use of the site, especially information from children under 13.

The Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act (“COPPA”) requires that we

  • Notify parents and guardians on how we collect, use, and disclose personal information from children under the age of 13
  • Obtain verifiable consent from parents and guardians in order for children under the age of 13 to utilize certain aspects of the Site
  • Require the child to disclose no more information than is reasonably necessary for a child to participate in a given activity on this site
  • Allow the parent to review and delete the information collected about their child

What this privacy policy covers

This privacy policy is designed to answer your questions regarding the privacy policy and the collection of information through the Site. “Personal information” and “personally identifiable information” refer to information that can specifically identify you or your child.

What information does Kid Everest collect from users? How is it collected?

  • We do not collect any personally identifiable information from anyone unless they register with our site.
  • The information we collect during the user registration process is a an age. From there, Kid Everest collects the following: .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  . -If under the age of 13: first and last name, parent or legal guardian’s email. A parent/legal guardian will need to complete a Consent Form in order for a child to use the Site. The birth date is used to validate their age. The parent’s e-mail is used only to notify the parent of their child’s registration with the Site and subsequently, to approve that their child’s registration with the site by providing verifiable parental consent. For users under 13, their parent or legal guardian is required to approve their registration with KidEverest before using the website. During this process, we collect the parent’s full name, phone number, and email address directly from the parent. Users who join Kid Everest under a team or organizational account get access to certain features extended only to teams and organizational account (See Terms of Service for definition of account type.) such as but not limited to a discounted transaction fee and acknowledge that the team or organizational account will have access to their fundraiser and any information generated through from their membership under that fundraiser. By signing a Consent Form, a parent or legal guardian is consenting to the use of their child’s information to be used for social media and promotional purposes. .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  . -If 13 or older: first and last name, email address. This information will be used to create an account. .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .   -Backers (18 and over): Extensive personal information may be collected to ensure proper and honest usage of this Site. First and last name, email address, physical address and bank account information (through third party processors such as Paypal and Stripe) may be collected.
  • Last names of project creators will never be made public on the Site.
  • All Users and Members of the Site will require a valid bank account. Third party processor accounts such as Stripe or Paypal will need to be added in order for donations to be processed and for funds to be dispersed to project creators.
  • During use of the site, a child may voluntarily reveal to us additional information about himself or herself, such as contents of his or her emails to supporters, personal photos, phone number, videos, or written content describing their fundraiser. During the fundraiser set-up process, we also collect personal information in order to facilitate transfer of funds received into an associated bank account. A parent or legal guardian may delete any and all information about their child at any time from their dashboard portal or by contacting Kid Everest at Hello@kideverest.com . In the instance that a project cannot run because of parental deletion of critical information, the project will cancelled, and funds will be returned.
  • We never solicit information from a child. Parents should be aware that any personal information that the child chooses to disclose during the creation of their project or post on their pages are made public after launch and can be collected or used by others on the Site. During the time of registration, parents should monitor all data and talk to their children about Internet safety. If you wish to request removal of yours or your child’s personal information from these areas of the site, contact us at hello@KidEverest.com. In some cases, we may not be able to remove your personal information, in which case we will let you know if we are unable to do so and why. For more information on how to talk to your children about internet safety, please see the Federal Trade Commission’s website on Protecting Children’s Safety Online.
  • While on the Kid Everest website, children can access third party social media sites such as Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and Instagram.
  • We allow users and members to invite friends to join the site, either through an email invite or referral from a connected social media account. If they choose to do so through email, we will collect the recipient’s first name and email address. We use this information to send them a one-time email invitation.
  • When giving money or making a donation, supporters are required to give their full name, email address, and then billing information through secure third party processors. We currently use Stripe (www.stripe.com) or PayPal (www.paypal.com) as our processors. The supporter’s full name, email address, the amount donated, date of donation, and physical mailing address is available to the member they donated to, the member’s parent, and organizational account holder (if applicable) and may be used for purposes of facilitating the donation transaction, gift fulfillment (thank you), and further follow-up.
  • KidEverest collects personal information passively, by using cookies to track traffic analytics and to monitor unique visitors to our site. This information is used to improve KidEverest as a website. KidEverest may also collect user’s IP addresses. This information is used to prevent and monitor fraud, diagnose technical problems, and estimate demographic data. We do not link the information we store in cookies to any personal information you submit while on our site.
  • KidEverest utilizes third party marketing and tracking utility partners to analyze trends, administer the site, and track users’ movements throughout the site. These services may employ the use of cookies. While we do not have access or control over third party cookies, users can opt out of these services by following directions provided below on each third party site or by disabling the use of cookies entirely.
  • We employ third party tracking utility services (Google Analytics) which collect behavioral data on what actions a user took on our site, what pages they viewed, what they clicked, browser, device, IP address, geo-location based on the IP address, and operating system data. We use Google Analytics to see how you use our website and mobile application so that we can improve your experience. We encourage you to read the Google Privacy Policy. If you don’t want your data reported by Google Analytics, you can install the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on. (https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout).
  • KidEverest occasionally works with third party affiliate partners to reach new users. If you were referred to us by an affiliate, we will employ the use of a cookie for up to 6 months from your first visit to ensure our affiliate gets credit for the referral.
  • We collect IP address solely to support internal operations. Other than that, none of these services collect any personally identifying information. Our third party tracking utility partners employ a software technology called clear gifs (a.k.a. Web Beacons/Web Bugs), that help us better manage content on our site by informing us what content is effective. Clear gifs are tiny graphics with a unique identifier, similar in function to cookies, and are used to track the online movement of Web users. In contrast to cookies, which are stored on a user’s computer hard drive, clear gifs are embedded invisibly on Web pages and are about the size of the period at the end of this sentence. We do not tie the information gathered by clear gifs to our customers’ personal information.
  • As true of most web sites, we gather certain information automatically and store it in log files. This information may include Internet protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, internet service provider (ISP), referring/exit pages, operating system, date/time stamp, and/or clickstream data. We do not link this automatically.

If you have any inquiries regarding our partner’s privacy practices or how they use your child’s personal information, please contact us directly at hello@KidEverest.com

How are parents notified, given consent, or able to access/change/delete information collected from their children under 13?

  • Parents are sent an email containing all the information collected from a child under 13 if their child registers with the Site. If a parent does not agree with terms or privacy policy and does not want their child to participate on KidEverest, they can cancel their child’s account by emailing hello@KidEverest.com. Parents provide verifiable consent by printing a Consent Form, signing it, and returning it via email.
  • Parents can access, change, or delete information about their child at anytime or refuse further collection and use of the information collected from the child by emailing us at the email address listed below. Parents can access their child’s account using the login information sent to them when their child registered with us or contact Membership Support by emailing us at hello@KidEverest.com.
  • Parents have the right to consent to our collection and use of personal information collected from their child without having to consent to its disclosure to third parties as we do not share information collected from a child with third parties.
  • Kid Everest may use the information collected about your child and their project in order to share with potential new and existing Users or Members. This would include using any information consented to and shared on the front end of the Site. Sharing of this information includes, but not limited to, subscriber emails, sharing to social media such as Facebook, Twitter or Instagram.
  • We will retain your or your child’s information for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide services. If you wish to cancel the account or request that we no longer use the information to provide services contact us at the email address listed above. We will retain and use the information as necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements.

Do third-party sites or sponsors use information collected?

Kid Everest does not rent, sell, or share personal information about you collected in connection with your use of the service with third parties. Kid Everest may, however, make inquiries, either directly or through third parties, to validate the registration information provided by users and parents in order to prevent misrepresentation and fraud on the site.

We may provide your personal information to companies that provide services to help us with our business activities such as offering customer service. These companies are authorized to use your personal information only as necessary to provide these services to us.

We may also disclose your personal information as required by law, such as to comply with a subpoena, or similar legal process, when we believe in good faith that disclosure is necessary to protect our rights, protect your safety or the safety of others, investigate fraud, or respond to a government request.

If Kid Everest is acquired or merged with another company, we may also transfer your information as part of that transaction, as permitted by applicable law. Kid Everest will notify you before your information is transferred and becomes subject to a different privacy policy

How do I edit my information?

To modify or delete any or all of the personal information you have provided to us, log in and update your account or fundraisers or email hello@KidEverest.com. We will respond to your access request within 30 days.

Additional information

Security

We use Stripe and PayPal to process payments and donations. We are PCI compliant. All credit card information entered is transmitted via Secure Socket Layer (SSL) technology, assuming that you have selected the secure server method and that your browser supports this functionality. No credit card information is transmitted through, nor stored on, KidEverest servers. All credit card information goes directly to our payment processors. Regardless, no data transmission over the public Internet is ever guaranteed to be 100% secure.

The security of your personal information is important to us. We follow generally accepted industry standards to protect the personal information submitted to us, both during transmission and once we receive it. No method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure, however. Therefore, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

Social Media Sharing and Widgets

Kid Everest includes social media features, such as the ability to share fundraiser pages on Facebook and Twitter. These features require you to login to post to your own account and they may collect your IP address, which page you are visiting on our site, and may set a cookie to enable the feature to function properly. These features are either hosted by a third party or hosted directly on our Site. Your interactions with these features are governed by the privacy policy of the company providing it.

Links to Other Sites

This Web site contains links to other sites that are not owned or controlled by us. These are posted by fundraiser users, team members, and donors. Please be aware that we are not responsible for the privacy practices of other sites.

We encourage you to be aware when you leave our site and to read the privacy policies of each and every Web site that collects personal information.

This privacy policy only applies to information collected by this Website.

Promotional Programs

From time-to-time we may have opportunities to create promotional programs or to match sponsors interested in supporting or promoting fundraisers. In some cases, your participation may require you to provide personally identifiable information. Participation in any promotion that requires additional information will be completely voluntary and you therefore have a choice whether or not to disclose this information. This does not refer to promoting publicly viewable fundraisers which require no additional information from you.

Changes to Privacy Policy

We may update this privacy statement to reflect changes to our information practices. If we make any material changes we will notify you by means of a notice on this Site prior to the change becoming effective. We encourage you to periodically review this page for the latest information on our privacy practices.

If we make material changes to how we use Personal Information collected from children under age 13, we will notify parents by email in order to obtain verifiable parental consent for the new uses of the child’s Personal Information.

Emails

We will send users over the age of 13 (if under 13, parent’s will receive emails) emails related to their personal transactions and account/service related updates. Users will also be sent fundraiser updates and newsletters, which they also may opt out of.
